doc.after: The territory between the Lower Danube and the Black Sea remained a fully integrated part of the Roman Empire, even after the abandonment of Trajan's Dacia.[47] It was transformed into a separate province under the name of Scythia Minor[48] around 293.[49] Before 300, the Romans erected small forts at Dierna and in other places on the northern bank of the Danube in modern-day Banat.[50][51] In their wider region, Roman coins from the periodâmostly of bronzeâhave been found.[52]
